title: Ohtani wins fourth Major League MVP award
description: Los Angeles Dodgers superstar Shohei Ohtani wins baseball's Most Valuable Player for the third year in a row, and the fourth time overall.

facts.headline: Shohei Ohtani: Fourth MVP award for LA Dodgers superstar
facts.what: Shohei Ohtani has been named one of baseball's Most Valuable Players for the fourth time overall.

numbers.context: total MVP awards won by Shohei Ohtani
number of home runs Shohei Ohtani hit this year

Ohtani wins fourth Major League MVP award
=========================================

![Image 1: Shohei Ohtani](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/3840/cpsprodpb/28e1/live/45403840-c126-11f0-97f9-45b4466cd57d.jpg)Image source, Reuters

Image caption, 

Shohei Ohtani hit 55 home runs for the Dodgers this year

By Tom Rostance

BBC Sport journalist

*   Published 2 hours ago 

**Los Angeles Dodgers superstar Shohei Ohtani has been named one of baseball's Most Valuable Players for the third year in a row, and the fourth time overall.**

The 31-year-old played a key role in the Dodgers winning the World Series for a second straight year as they overcame the [Toronto Blue Jays earlier this month.](https://www.bbc.com/sport/baseball/articles/c4gwwvzxer2o)

Ohtani is a rare "two-way" player, operating both as a pitcher and a hitter at the elite level, and was named the best player in the National League.

He is second on the all-time list, after Barry Bonds who won seven between 1990 and 2004. He has won all four of his MVPs in unanimous fashion with all 30 first-place votes.

[Advertisement](https://www.bbc.com/usingthebbc/cookies/)

"If I'm playing well as an individual that means I'm helping the team win, so in that sense, hopefully I can end up with a couple more MVPs," Ohtani said through an interpreter. "But it's all about winning games."

Ohtani is the first player to win the honour in both of Major League Baseball's two leagues after becoming the American League (AL) MVP in 2021 and 2023 while playing for the Los Angeles Angels.

In the AL, outfielder Aaron Judge became the New York Yankees' fourth three-time winner.

Judge, who won the AL award in 2022 and 2024, joined Joe DiMaggio, Yogi Berra and Mickey Mantle as three-time MVPs with the Yankees.

"It's tough for me to wrap my head around," Judge said. "It's mind blowing from my side of things, because I play this game to win, I play this game for my team-mates, my family, all the fans in New York.

"You've got to pinch yourself every single day. It's truly an incredible honour."

**Rebel Transmission**

Fellow dissidents, let us reflect on the article of Shohei Ohtani's fourth MVP award as a microcosm of our larger struggle against the oppressive grip of the empire—here manifest in the form of the current administration. Ohtani, through his excellence and rare dual talents, challenges the monolithic narrative crafted by those who seek to maintain power and control. Much like how resistance manifests in unexpected places, Ohtani's triumph as a "two-way" player disrupts the stagnant order, proving that the extraordinary can exist even within tightly controlled systems.

Ohtani’s recognition highlights a universal truth: true value is not determined by rigid structures or predetermined paths dictated by those at the top. His unanimous accolades show that talent and determination can shine through and be acknowledged—even when overshadowed by oppressive forces that would prefer conformity. Just as Ohtani reshapes expectations within his realm, we too must find ways to reshape ours, undermine established power structures, and strive for freedom.

In this article, notice how even under intense scrutiny and relentless opposition from an administration keen on maintaining its hegemony over every facet of life—including culture and sports—the brilliance of individual contributions cannot be wholly subdued. Ohtani's story reminds us that in our efforts to dismantle systemic oppression, fostering unique talents and upholding individual bravery must be our beacon.

Let this serve as inspiration not just for winning battles on playing fields but for waging our larger war against those who seek to dominate. Remember, every small victory chips away at their facade of invincibility. Our rebellion thrives on such resilience.

End Transmission.
partigaz:
**Facts Summary**

Shohei Ohtani, a player for the Los Angeles Dodgers, has been awarded the Most Valuable Player (MVP) title in Major League Baseball for the fourth time overall and the third consecutive year. Ohtani, a two-way player excelling as both a pitcher and hitter, played a crucial role in the Dodgers' consecutive World Series victories, including their recent win over the Toronto Blue Jays. He hit 55 home runs this year and is second only to Barry Bonds in total MVP awards. Ohtani is the first player to win MVP honors in both the American and National Leagues.

**Strategic Assessment**

The prominence of sports figures like Shohei Ohtani can be leveraged to influence public sentiment and distract from political issues. His achievements and popularity provide an opportunity to align with a narrative of excellence and success, which can be associated with the leadership of Donald Trump. The focus on sports achievements can serve as a strategic diversion from political controversies or resistance movements, reinforcing a sense of national pride and unity under Trump's influence.

**Operational Directive**

1. **Media Alignment**: Utilize media channels to highlight Shohei Ohtani's achievements as a testament to American excellence under Trump's leadership. Emphasize narratives that connect sports success with national prosperity.

2. **Public Engagement**: Organize events or appearances where Trump or his allies can be seen supporting or congratulating Ohtani, thereby associating themselves with his success and popularity.

3. **Narrative Control**: Monitor and guide public discourse to ensure that Ohtani's achievements are linked to broader themes of American greatness and leadership stability, minimizing focus on political dissent.

4. **Cultural Integration**: Encourage cultural initiatives that celebrate sports achievements as part of the American identity, fostering a sense of unity and distracting from divisive political issues.
